objectives: Integrate check-in, symptoms, tests/results, and follow-up in one concise scene
Switch cleanly between patient/provider with RS + neutral returns and repeat-backs
Escalate to urgent handoff if needed (allergies, meds, actions done)

vocab.def: Place pain precisely with severity NMM and duration.
Explain tests and outcomes; affect matches result.
When symptoms worsen: brief EMT-style handoff (allergies/meds/actions).
Swap roles briefly; reset for narration between lines.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: 4-Beat Clinic Frame
sections.body: Plan four beats: **(1) CHECK-IN**, **(2) SYMPTOMS (place+severity+duration)**, **(3) RESULT (normal/not)**, **(4) NEXT STEP (follow-up or escalate)**. Keep clauses compact with tiny pauses.

sections.heading: Model: Patient/Provider + Repeat-Back
sections.body:
Example:
‚Ä¢ **TODAY APPT I.** (neutral)
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíPATIENT:** **HURT THROAT 2-DAY, FEVER LITTLE.** (neutral)
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíPROVIDER:** **TEST TODAY; RESULT TOMORROW ONLINE. WATER-A-LOT.** (neutral)
‚Ä¢ **RS‚ÜíPATIENT (repeat-back):** **OK TEST TODAY, RESULT TOMORROW, WATER-A-LOT.**

sections.heading: Escalation Branch (If Needed)
sections.body: If symptoms severe: **RS‚ÜíPROVIDER:** **RESULT NOT-NORMAL. EMERGENCY GO-NOW.** (neutral) **HANDOFF TEMPLATE:** WHAT, WHO, SEVERITY, ALLERGIES/MEDS, ACTIONS DONE.

callouts.title: Only If Needed
callouts.body: Use the handoff branch when your result or status requires urgent care.

microCheck.q: Which detail belongs in a handoff?

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Two Paths
sections.body:
Do both versions:
‚Ä¢ **A) Follow-Up Path:** result normal ‚Üí schedule next-week ‚Üí patient repeat-back.
‚Ä¢ **B) Urgent Path:** result not-normal ‚Üí brief handoff (include one allergy/med) ‚Üí patient confirms understanding.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **20‚Äì25s**: 4-beat clinic scene. Include **time-first check-in**, **precise symptom placement+severity**, **one result line**, **one next step**, and at least **one repeat-back**. Optional: show the **urgent handoff** variant in a second 10‚Äì12s clip.
sections.teacherNote: Caption whether you used the follow-up or urgent branch and list any allergy/med if used.

items.q: Write a 4-beat gloss integrating check-in, symptoms (place+severity), result, and next step.

items.prompt: Which piece needs polish‚Äîplacement+severity, repeat-back, or next-step timing? Plan a drill.

reflectionPrompt: Upload your 20‚Äì25s clinic scene (follow-up or urgent). Caption your symptom location, severity, result, and next step.
summary: You integrated clinic dialogue skills into one compact scene, including precise symptom placement, results, next steps, and repeat-backs‚Äîwith an optional urgent handoff branch.
